intro: Adenophora polymorpha f. multiloba, commonly known as the multilobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It typically grows in moist, woodland environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in botanical studies.
